summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has helped Palantir redefine its business over the last two years . The company's main growth catalyst is now the private sector . Analyst Dan Ives thinks the company could reach a $1 trillion valuation in two or three years .  Palantir's shares have gained about 1,090% since its initial public offering (IPO) in 2020 . Much of the company's business still revolves around government contracts . Rising interest in AI has fueled a new wave of potential for the company -- particularly in the private sector .  Palantir has relied heavily on deal flow from the DOD and adjacent government agencies for much of its 20-year history . While there are big bucks to be made in defense contracting, public sector business tends to be lumpy . Wall Street loathes businesses whose growth prospects look unreliable .  Palantir's dominance in the software realm over the last couple of years, coupled with a bullish overall sentiment around the AI opportunity, explains the stock's incredible rise . The company is also signing more meaningful deals, underscored by consistently rising revenue and widening profit margins .  Palantir is one of the priciest stocks in the software space today, and history suggests that shares are due for a pullback . The average consensus price target among analysts is about $94, suggesting about 21% downside . Back in the late 1990s, internet stocks were experiencing their own moment of euphoria .  Palantir's valuation multiples will likely compress over the next couple of years . Investors should prepare for some valuation compression in the near term . Valuation multiples generally normalize over the long term .  The most prudent strategy regarding an investment in Palantir is to buy the stock at different price points and take advantage of dips . That doesn't necessarily mean the company won't ever become a trillion-dollar stock . Instead of focusing on the next two or three years, investors should think longer term . After a terrible start to 2025, tech stocks are regaining some of their lost value . Artificial intelligence remains a huge driving force for earnings and revenue growth . The Nasdaq has recovered about half of its losses from peak to trough .  Amazon Web Services generated $29.3 billion last quarter, up 17% year over year . The company is planning for over $100 billion in capital expenditures in 2025 . It's also investing heavily in its own custom silicon solutions for AI .  Amazon has spent the last few years overhauling its logistics system to drive higher efficiency . The results have been fantastic: Shipping expenses grew just 3% year over year last quarter . Amazon remains an indispensable platform for developers and a leading resource for AI tools and services through AWS .  Lam Research is one of the top manufacturers of semiconductor fabrication equipment . All of the high-end AI chips going into data centers pass through its machines at various stages of their construction . Lam has a particular edge in equipment for memory chips .  Lam benefits from a virtuous cycle as a leading equipment provider to chip manufacturers . Last quarter, its revenue grew by 24%, and management expects growth to accelerate in Q2 . Lam shares have dropped considerably from the highs reached back in 2024 .  Meta Platforms is the company behind Facebook and Instagram . It's making some of the tech sectors' biggest bets on artificial intelligence . Management has increased its plans for capital spending this year to between $64 billion and $72 billion .  AI-powered marketing tools can help advertisers design and test new campaigns . CEO Mark Zuckerberg eventually sees Meta's AI acting as an agent for businesses . AI agents could also serve key roles in customer service and sales via Meta's messaging apps, WhatsApp and Messenger .  Meta stock still trades for just 23 times forward earnings estimates . Given its potential to book double-digit percentage earnings growth, Meta's stock is too cheap to ignore at this price .  John Mackey, former CEO of Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Randi Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook and sister to Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg .

Glacier, the San Francisco-based AI robotics startup, announced a $16 million Series A funding round on Tuesday to expand deployment of its waste-sorting robots across U.S. recycling facilities . Amazon has included the startup in its broader strategy to reduce single-use fossil fuel plastics across Amazon Fresh and Whole Foods packaging lines .  Recology, a major waste management company, is using Glacier's technology to modernize recycling at its South Seattle material recovery facility . Equipped with AI vision, the robots identify and grab items like shampoo bottles, milk jugs, and soda cans using suction-powered arms .  Glacier's robots currently operate in Washington state, California, Michigan, Arizona, and Illinois . The machines can recover 80%–90% of target materials, roughly matching the accuracy of human sorters .  Recology is testing Glacier's robots for use with bio-based plastics, such as biopolyesters . Washington state lawmakers recently passed Senate Bill 5284, which would require product brands to help with recycling while standardizing materials accepted curbside . Between 2023 and 2024, theS&P 500 generated total returns of 58% and 87% . Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms all confirmed their plans for massive AI infrastructure spending . Advanced Micro Devices also shared encouraging details regarding the outlook for its next-generation GPUs .  Nvidia could see its shares surge after it reports its first-quarter results on May 28 . Investors ought to pay close attention toMicrosoft,Amazon,Alphabet,Meta Platforms, andAdvanced Micro Devices .  These three "Magnificent Seven" members are on track to spend a combined $260 billion on AI capex this year . AMD, Meta Platforms and AMD are also spending big on AI-powered wearable hardware .  The graph below illustrates Nvidia's stock price over the last three years . Nvidia stock has risen considerably across this period -- but we already knew that . Since Nvidia reported its Q2 2024 earnings in August, the stock has actually dropped by about 9%.  Analysts' consensus estimates are for Nvidia's revenue and earnings to nearly double over the next two years . Su's remarks underscore this idea, as she expects production of AMD's next-generation chip architecture to begin scaling up in the latter portion of the year .  Nvidia remains well positioned to dominate the AI infrastructure market over the coming years . For these reasons, I think Nvidia stock will soar following its earnings report later this month . I see the stock as a no-brainer buying opportunity right now .  John Mackey, former CEO of Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Randi Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook .  This article was originally published by The Motley Fool . The World Economic Forumpredicts that 92 million roles will be displaced by current technological trends, but that 170 million new jobs will be created . For those who don't have the economic power, or the intellectual interest, to get a master’s degree in AI and machine learning, what does the bot-filled future look like for them?  Amazon's new Vulcan robot that can “feel’s” can pick up items stored in the middle of a warehouse . Amazon says it is training a small number of warehouse workers to become robot technicians .  Amazon says it's offering a job retraining program for some workers to gain robotic maintenance skills . Amazon didn’t say so, this would obviously not be a 1:1 conversion . It wouldn't require an army of humans to oversee the robots in the same way it needs them to fulfill warehouse orders .  Running robots becomes like operating a PC: Pretty much everyone needs to know how to do it to be employable . Bots could remain the purview of only the biggest and most deep-pocketed companies . The vast majority of retail, restaurants, and driving jobs continue to be done by humans .  Amazon is offering a glimpse at new jobs in an AI-bot world today . The company is hoping to use Amazon's cloud computing to create new jobs for humans .

Amazon Prime membership fee is $14.99 a month or $139 per year . At the beginning of 2022, the cost of Amazon Primewas $119 annually . The price increase for Prime membership plans went into effect on Feb. 18, 2022 .  Amazon is expected to increase the price of its Prime Membership from $139 annually to $159 by 2026 . Amazon Prime members receive access to Prime Video, Prime Gaming, Prime Music and access to Kindle Owners’ Lending Library .  Some members of Amazon Prime may appreciate the swift way the service provides deliveries of groceries via Amazon Fresh or using the Amazon Pharmacy service . However, savvy shoppers may be focusing on other retailers and supermarkets where they can get even better deals .  If you have decided that a Prime membership no longer meets your needs, you can easily end it . Prime members need to weigh whether they’re getting a better deal with Prime versus other retailers .

If you invested in Amazon at the start of any year over the last 20 years, you'd be up on your investment five years later, every time . Amazon's retail and cloud-computing business is growing at a triple-digit pace . The market for Amazon's biggest moneymaker could more than quintuple over the next two decades .  Amazon had net sales of nearly $100 billion in the first quarter of 2025 alone . The company has many moving parts, so honing in on just retail operations is challenging . With its massive customer base, as well as sprawling infrastructure for logistics and shipping, I don't believe anyone will meaningfully disrupt Amazon anytime soon .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) has generated $112 billion in trailing-12-month net sales . But investors shouldn't think that growth is peaking simply because of its already gargantuan scale . AWS is a leading platform in the cloud-computing space, which Jassy expects to quintuple .  The company's main retail business will be fine, in spite of tariff headwinds . And AWS is poised for a decade or more of solid growth . Amazon's AI business is growing at a greater than 100% annual pace and is generating billions of dollars in annual net sales .  Amazon's profits should grow dramatically as it grows, thanks to AI and a shift in IT spending to the cloud . It might not show up immediately in 2025 -- patience is still important . But I'm comfortable in my belief that Amazon's . profits will be meaningfully higher in five years, which will likely send the stock higher . Bill Miller is considered a legend for his value investing approach . Miller beat the broader benchmarkS&P 500 index for 15 consecutive years from 1991 to 2005 . He also founded Miller Value Funds and continues to invest through the firms' various funds .  Tesla is the only stock in the "Magnificent Seven" that Miller seems to think is overvalued . Miller doesn't believe Tesla is a bad company, but he says it's too expensive . Miller: "They're going to have to knock the cover off the ball in terms of self-driving cars and AI"  Much of Tesla's valuation seems to depend on future initiatives . Miller said: "Tesla's charging $8,000 for their self-driving system, and BYD's cars, I think they're just better"  Miller views concerns about the company's exposure to China to be overblown . Miller: "the largest personal owner of Amazon whose last name isn't Bezos" Miller: Amazon has some of the most advanced supply chain capabilities in the world .  Amazon has revenue diversity from the likes of AWS and advertising streams that have been performing well . Even if the trade war between the U.S. and China lasts longer than expected, I expect Amazon canweather the storm, although earnings could take a temporary hit . Amazon trade attractively at 30 times forward earnings, which is near the stock's five-year low .  If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009, you’d have $302,503! Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies . There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . The long-term investing thesis for Amazon remains as strong as it was when the stock was hitting all-time highs . Google parent Alphabet faces big challenges, but it should also continue to be a big winner . The Trade Desk is still the leader in a market with huge growth potential .  Amazon's shares are 22% below the high from earlier this year at the time of this writing . This sell-off is due to concerns about the negative impacts oftariffs . I suspect Amazon's business could hold up better than many expect . Exorbitant tariff levels will almost certainly be temporary .  Amazon remains as solid as it was when its share price was hitting all-time highs just a few months ago . E-commerce still has a lot of room to expand. Organizations will continue shifting their IT spending to the cloud. Artificial intelligence (AI) will remain a massive tailwind. Amazon is poised to benefit from all these trends .  The antitrust rulings could cause major headaches for Google . But I wouldn't get the cart before the horse: Alphabet just might come out in better shape than expected . Betting against Google in search or AI is ill-advised in my view .  The Trade Desk's share price has cratered this year . The adtech stock is down almost 60% from its record high hit in the fourth quarter of 2024 . But don't play a funeral dirge for this one-time highflier . I think the Trade Desk could be like the mythical phoenix rising from the ashes .  This adtech stock's crisis presents a great opportunity for long-term investors . If my answers to these questions are right, buying The Trade Desk now should pay off handsomely over the coming years . Amazon has tremendous growth opportunities in e-commerce, cloud services, AI, and more . The company is a financial juggernaut, with Wall Street projecting accelerating earnings growth . Amazon is the ultimate growth stock to buy with $1,000 right now .  Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said in October 2024 that his company only claims around 1% of the global retail market . He added that 80% to 85% of that market segment share lives in physical stores . I suspect Jassy is right about the big e-commerce opportunity . He also thinks he's right about growth prospects for the cloud services market .  Artificial intelligence (AI) presents a massive growth opportunity for Amazon beyond AWS . Amazon continues to expand further into healthcare, recently announcing the ability to fill pet medication prescriptions on Amazon Pharmacy . The company's Zoox should have significant growth prospects in the robotaxi market .  Amazon posted a Q1 profit of $17.1 billion, up more than 64% year over year . Analysts project the company will increase its sales to a whopping $762 billion in 2026 . Amazon generatedfree cash flow of $25.9 billion over the 12 months ended March 31, 2025 to $155.7 billion .  Forward-looking investors should take advantage of the pullback in Amazon's share price, in my opinion . This ultimate growth stock might not be available at a discount for too much longer . Amazon could weather the storm better than many expect because it's the lowest-price online retailer in the U.S.  Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, available when you joinStock Advisor, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon . AMD's revenue surged 36% year over year last quarter, yet its stock trades at just 22 times this year's earnings estimate . C3.ai could see accelerating demand for its AI software following partnerships with Microsoft .  AMD's data center segment posted a 57% year-over-year increase in revenue . Amazon recently revealed a small stake in the company's stock, which is a vote of confidence in AMD's technology .  Amazon revealed a new stake in AMD stock worth $84 million at the end of Q1 . Amazon's investment could signal confidence in AMD's offering, especially as a lower-cost alternative to AI chip leader Nvidia . AMD's forward price-to-earnings multiple of 22 seems to significantly undervalue AMD's ability to serve a massive AI chip opportunity .  C3.ai reported a 26% year-over-year increase in revenue in the January-ending fiscal third quarter . The consensus Wall Street estimate has the company's revenue increasing by 25% next quarter . Its software is used for classified work in the U.S. military and mission-critical software for large corporations .  C3.ai is winning over industry leaders with its focus on solving complicated problems for large businesses that have sprawling supply chains and global operations . Palantir stock commands a high price-to-sales multiple of 87 at the time of this writing .
